p: Majority of participants were male (91.3%), and 35.4% (n = 102) of them were classified as pig exposed. The mean age for the participants was 35.5 years with a significant difference between the mean age of pig exposed (32.5 years) and non-pig exposed persons (37.2 years). Although 55.9% of all participants had completed at least secondary education, 5% of non-pig exposed had no formal education whereas all pig exposed participants had some formal education (Table 1).
